violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
A FOOD specified in ¶ 3-501.17(A) or (B) shall be discarded if it:  
    (1) Exceeds the temperature and time combination specified in ¶ 3-501.17(A),              except time that the product is frozen; (P)
    (2) Is in a container or PACKAGE that does not bear a date or day; (P) or
    (3) Is appropriately marked with a date or day that exceeds a temperature and              time combination as specified in ¶ 3-501.17(A). (P)
violationsByInspectionidList.itemDescription: Ready to eat, potentially hazardous food(s)

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
Sec. 2129. (1) All food establishments shall employ a minimum of 1 managerial employee as a food safety manager, who must be an individual who is currently certified under a personnel certification program accredited by the American National Standards Institute, utilizing the Conference for Food Protection standards:
(2) Beginning January 14, 2017 and every 5 years thereafter, a certified  food safety manager who supervises the operations of a food service establishment shall have completed a food safety training program
containing an allergen awareness  component that has been approved by  the department. A food service establishment shall retain records on the  site of the food service establishment documenting compliance of its  certified food safety managers with this subsection.

violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: A Person in Charge is required to be present during all hours of operation.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: Except otherwise approved, and except for antislip floor coverings or applications may be used for safety reasons, floors, floor coverings, walls, wall coverings, and ceilings shall be designed, constructed, and installed so they are SMOOTH and EASILY CLEANABLE.
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Not constructed, designed, installed according to law
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Remove and replace to be in compliance with law.
